content: Government funding program The **Technology Incubation Scheme** (TIS) was a [government funding](/wiki/Government_funding) program of the National Research Foundation (NRF) of [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). The scheme was started in 2009 and ended on 30 June 2016. ## Details of the Program The TIS program selected [funds](/wiki/Investment_fund) that matched the following criteria: - Funds that can [incubate](/wiki/Business_incubator) and nurture young [start-ups](/wiki/Start-ups) prior to [venture capital](/wiki/Venture_capital) funding. - The program matches [investments](/wiki/Investments) up-to 85% co-funding of a private incubator (maximum S$500,000). - Incubators have the option to buy out NRF's [equity](/wiki/Equity_(finance)) of the company. [Option](/wiki/Option_(finance)) is valid for 3 years (post TIS investment). ## Incubators accepted into the Program As of 1 August 2013, there are currently 14 approved funds to work with the [Singapore Government](/wiki/Government_of_Singapore) as part of the program: - The [Biofactory](/wiki/Biofactory) - Clearbridge Accelerator - Get2Volume - [Golden Gate Ventures](/wiki/Golden_Gate_Ventures) - Incuvest - Jungle Ventures - Plug&Play Singapore - Red Dot Ventures - Small World Group - Stream Global - Silicon Straits - TechCube8 - TNF Ventures - Wavemakers Labs ## Funded under Technology Incubation Scheme - Rainmaker Labs - Singapore Mobile App Development Company - SG Entrepreneur's article on incubators in Singaporeâ€™s Technology Incubation Scheme
title: Technology Incubation Scheme
